reporting-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

title.narrative: Paraguay - Training of Paraguay Plant Protection and Quarantine Officers

description.narrative: Support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade.

This award strives to support the science and practice of food, feed, and fiber production (including forestry, wildlife, fisheries, aquaculture and floriculture) and its relationships to natural resources, processing, marketing, distribution, utilization (including nutrition), and trade. In addition, this award From Oct 13-14, 2014, an APHIS subject matter expert participated in a training program for Paraguay Plant Heath Service (SENAVE) officials, in coordination with the Interamerican Institute for Cooperation in Agriculture (IICA) and the University of Asuncion. The training program involved a series of lectures given by APHIS including basic aspects of trade of agricultural products (including risk assessments), market access and rulemaking, phytosanitary treatments for pest mitigation, and inspection processes in the United States to protect U.S. Agriculture. 38 local inspectors participated in this training..

participating-org.narrative: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service (APHIS)
The federal government of the United States

participating-org.usg:office-name: Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service

owner-org.narrative: The federal government of the United States

description.narrative: The Government of Paraguay is making significant advances in fighting corruption and impunity and eradicating extreme poverty. Encouraged by a recently approved Freedom of Information Law and widely available public notices, citizens are denouncing irregularities and sending a clear message that corruption will not be tolerated. Although high levels of income inequality remain, Paraguayan government programs are producing positive results in reducing poverty and in countering illicit activities in the northern region. U.S. assistance programs add momentum to these positive developments, helping Paraguay strengthen its democratic institutions and supporting more equitable and environmentally sustainable economic growth.

usg:treasury-account.usg:main-account: Agricultural Quarantine Inspection User Fee Account, Animal and Plant Health Inspection Service
